text: <@UG4GFNPL2> use this as a starting point: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tutorials/combining-multiple-sets-of-blog-posts-into-a-single-listing>

is there a way to override these errors?  I have multiple country locations so I have to hard-code the addresses in the footer of my email template Error:This template is missing the required tag {{ site_settings.company_street_address_1 }}
the way i have done it in the past is I have one of the locations be set in site settings and use the vars for that specific location, and just type the others.
doesn’t matter if you do it in the template or in a module loaded in the template.
My french and German teams need to be able to have a template set for them'
I'm trying to edit it in a module and when I hard-code the addresses I can't get past the required error

ahh, so you’re saying that you’re not displaying both locations in your footer you need to only show 1? that’s different.

You may have to do some unfortunately shady stuff by keeping the HubL vars in and use css to make them invisible
my situation I had I was able to have each location noted in the email’s footer. so I didn’t have to “turn it off” for one set of emails

If you want to add CTA in your template.. very simple. just navigate to marketing > lead capture> CTA from there create your CTA and publish it..  after that call that CTA to your template.

there are two way of adding CTA -
1: you can also CTA through rich text.
2: there is also a option of directly calling that CTA.
